page.title: 01GAZETTEER..
page.content: This 12 sq. km. area lies between two small towns -some 4 km east of Auchtermuchty and 6 km west of Cupar. It lies on the north side of the valley of the Howe of Fife. The land slopes gently from 106m in the north down to 46m. It is generally fertile land underlain by the glacial outwash sands and gravel. Farmscape is dominant with arable farming being the major land use. There is an enclosed field pattern. Quarrying, forestry and recreation are other land uses in the area but are of much lesser significance. Apart from the scattered farm population there is the small village of Collesie. Like many rural areas the lack of public transport and the closure of rural primary schools are important issues.
